channel.title: How do i do this? i need help
channel.description: Ok, so, I want to post a 508 on the server status checker. I'm currently hosting a 317 on port 1357. I want to host the 508, so whenever I go to the status checker and try to post it there, it says it's been approved. Then, it will not show up on the next update. So, then, I tried to make it like I'm posting a 317. I put my port 1357. I put an IP I use for the 317 and I named it Something with 508 in the title. Then in the description, I put you need an client with an IP changer and that didn't show up on the update either...

item.title: How do i do this? i need help
item.dc:creator: @_Codez0r `Codez0r
item.description:
@_Codez0r wrote:

Usually after an update, my server gets posted. Is there an easy way to advertise a 508 without getting in trouble? Like a legal way?

Read full topic
item.source: How do i do this? i need help

item.title: How do i do this? i need help
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

The update is for the status of the servers to be updated if they are offline/online and the online percentage, it doesn’t mean the server will be added to the list.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i do this? i need help

item.title: How do i do this? i need help
item.dc:creator: @_Codez0r `Codez0r
item.description:
@_Codez0r wrote:

No, after the certain amount of minutes I have to wait after posting it, it doesn’t show.

So, it says next update in 16.5 minutes, I goto post it. I wait. After the update, it’s not on the page.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i do this? i need help

item.title: How do i do this? i need help
item.dc:creator: @Trigger1 Trigger*
item.description:
@Trigger1 wrote:

It doesn’t update it then it shows. Can you not read? The people have to approve it.

Read full topic
